text.name: sys_description
text.text: The 64DD is a video game console peripheral which plugs into the extension port on the underside of the Nintendo 64 console. It was originally announced in 1996, but due to delays was released in Japan only during 1999. It uses a proprietary magnetic disk format and could connect to a dedicated online service named Randnet to share media along with a few other services.
